intro: Niphobolus africanus, commonly known as the African false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grassland and savanna habitats. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in a head, resembling those of the dandelion. Niphobolus africanus is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often found in open, sunny areas.
